reviews.review_msg: Awesome! Very approachable and takes the time to meet w/ students outside of class.
His accent makes it hard to understand him sometimes. No midterm, no final, but quizzes every class. Don't under estimate this class. It's harder than it seems. NOT RECOMMENDED.
No Comments
Eric is awesome. So easy and very helpful. No midterm or final for this course.

Overall this is not a difficult course if you 1) pay attention to requirements 2) communicate with your prof/TA and incorporate their feedback in your work. Prepare to write and research, a lot.   David provides detailed feedback which is on point and he is ready to answer questions. This course was a real learning opportunity.

Took Crim 343 via Distance Ed.  A proposal is due at the end of the semester, but it is broken up into 4 small papers. Dave is very friendly and gives great feedback. He is a fair marker and is always open to give suggestion on your proposal. He is always available for help via email or phone call.  I would recommend this class 100%!

I don't like Dave's teaching style, and i don't find him very helpful. He takes a long time to answer emails and his answers aren't helpful. He is slow at marking & expects you to be able to rewrite 20 pages & add in 10 more in a short time. He acts as if were all experts in Corrections when in reality the textbook is useless and we dont know much.

The class was based on papers and participation. if you want to do well in his class, get his advice by going on office hours. if you follow his feedback on papers you will get great marks. would highly recommend it for students who prefer papers over exams.

loved this course but would NEVER take a class with Dave Hunt again. Feedback seemed like he didn't even read the paper and returned papers only days before the next one is due - expecting you to edit 10-40 pages and add 10 more in an average of 3 days.  Replied to all of my emails with snarky one liners, 3 weeks later!
In terms of writing ability and style, Dave has helped me more  than any of my English instructors in college. Work hard, smart and efficiently and you should be fine in his course.

Easily the best course i've taken in my crim degree so far. David makes this one of the most enjoyable classes and although the work seems daunting everything is done in a fluid manner and his comments are SUPER helpful.

lots of work but not if you prefer essays to exams like myself. I didn't read a page of the textbooks and did great so i kinda wish i never bought the package from the bookstore. Take this class if you actually want to learn something that translates into the real world! One of the best classes i have ever taken.

I took this course online. It requires a lot of work, research, and readings; however, no exams. The professor is really helpful, fair, and provides feedback on all assignments. If you require an extension, he is very considerate. Overall, I learned a lot, was satisfied with what I learned and with my final paper, and I liked the course.

Very interesting class. Dave is super passionate with what he is doing and is very willing to help students! This is a very practical class and allow you to think outside the box. One of the best classes I have taken in my university career! Thanks Dave for the amazing learning experiences!

Dave is helpful and understanding, but his marking is a mess. Takes way too long and gives nearly everyone the same mark. The class is unlike anything else. If you're looking for a GPA boost, walk away. Only take Dave's class if you want to gain real life skills and are ready to work hard. Totally worth it, though!

The course was very informative and really helps you understand corrections in a practical way. However, although dave seems nice he was a hot mess while teaching this course, he took forever to give back the assignments, and made excuses for himself for why. He also doesn't give great marks and there is ALOT ALOT of writing (a total of 56 pages)

One of the toughest upper level CRIM courses. It's very self-directed, writing-intensive, and hard-core research-based. I do not like this course too much but Dave Hunt is THE BEST ONLINE TUTOR MARKER I have EVERRR had (& I took my fair share of DE courses at SFU). Very interactive. Truly cares about student needs. Knowledgeable. THE best TM.

The course itself, is something new, valuable but somewhat difficult and fairly self-directed.  However, David does his best to try and make sure the students understand.  He is clear and concise, and very knowledgeable. This class may be challenging but I would recommend it if you are interested in corrections.

David Hunt, hands down, the best prof/tm I have ever had in years of distance education.  He has a way of clearly communicating and helping each student to reach that AHA moment.  Wish there were more like him!

The class was interesting and very writing intensive. The teach was very helpful during the term but when asked for further help after the semester, he would not reply back to several e-mail attempts. Not a good professor is you are looking for a reference!

This course is definitely writing intensive, but the end product  is unlike anything that I have done during my post secondary schooling. While the course work appears extreme at first, it is actually divided into different sections and due dates that are clearly explained and make for a less intimidating assignment.

The class is different and unique from other crim courses, and it gives you experience that you can actually use in the real world. Dave was a great instructor and very helpful. This class requires time and interest but it definitely pays off. Dave gives lots of constructive feedback which helps the growth of your writing skills.

This class looks intimidating, but Dave was awesome and did a great job explaining and helping students. No exam, but lots of research! Allows you to think in a different way and challenges you. He gives great feedback, great advice and has tons of knowledge! He's very reassuring and it quick to calm anyone's fears. Awesome guy! Thanks David!

Fantastic Prof! His feedback was always helpful and he is VERY knowledgeable in the field of corrections. Great class as well... lots of work is required to do well but this is by far the most practical class I've taken. It really helped me learn a lot. Even if it was dist ed... best prof I've had and most enjoyable class I've taken.
Provides lots of constructive feedback and is very easy to contact.

There is a lot of work required for this class but it is broken down so it is not as overwhelming as it may seem in the beginning. The workload was well worth it and I would gladly choose the format of this class rather than the standard midterm/essay/final format. Dave, you should tell CODE to have more classes like this!

Awesome teacher. Very open to feedback, and his comments on the papers are very very useful. Researching for the proposal for this class has opened a whole new world for me. Dave is very helpful, and the corrections field being his career really helps because he has so much knowledge. Note: lots and lots of work and research, but no exam!! Whoo hoo

This course was quite challenging because it has a different format. Dave's passion for the course and his willingness to assist his students in achieving a realistic proposal is very inspiring. The amount of positive and sometimes constructive feedback that I recieved from Dave has made this whole experience worth while. Thank you.
Wonderful course and exprience. Way different from anything else I've ever taken. It's great taking a class that makes you think for yourself.
No Comments
made you think about your your oppinions and attitudes towards a particular subject and help firm up your foundational viewpoints on these.

FOR CRIM 304 : Amazing prof! I had her in first year and again now in 4th year. I will always take the class if she is teaching it. She is so sweet, caring and genuinely an amazing professor. Her lectures are always clear and I never leave the lecture confused. Absolute best CRIM professor, highly recommend.

20% to participation/weekly online discussion and quiz. No final! Midterm was a little tough, mixed MC and short answers, but if u actually study u will be fine. The other assignments were super easy. Dr.M is solid, she gives lots of readings and videos, but I haven't done any of them and am doing just fine. Gives free 3 day extensions on asgmnts

GOAT professor at SFU. Lectures are done in a very different way, where there is more engagement. Lectures fly by so fast that it does not feel like a 2 hour lecture. Grading criteria is very clear, and Dr. Murdoch is very caring. If you ever have the chance to take a course with Dr. Murdoch, then do it!!! Also, you don't need to buy a textbook.

Dr. Murdoch is an incredible professor who is immensely accommodating to students in regards to deadlines. Her group activities and creative projects motivated me to come to class every week and interact with others. She makes an effort to interact with every student and learn their names. Would absolutely recommend taking a class with Dr. Murdoch!
Dr. M is so kind and delivers great lectures! She tries to get to know her students even in a big class. The grading in this course was more difficult than I expected though.

Danielle was a super wonderful and kind professor, however the marking was so difficult. Averages were pretty low for every assignment/midterm and marks were docked multiple times for extremely small random things. The class was super interesting but the weekly reading that prepare you for the midterm were brutally long (total 15-50 pgs at times).

One of the best profs at SFU! The layout of the course is clear and she makes the content interesting. Midterm exam wasn't that bad and assignments included 2 writing assignments and an infographic (very unique) and the criteria for each are detailed with lots of information. Dr. Murdoch is caring and genuinely wants everyone to do well.

The teaching assistant marked harshly on papers, despite having perfect punctuation, spelling, grammar, and APA, and submitting my paper to a tutor for review still only received a C. Half the class was still writing the mid-term by the end of class? Classes are not online anymore!

Dr. Murdoch is very sweet and accomodating. However, the midterm exam for the class was very unreasonable. We were given two hours for 25 m/c + 5 shorter/long answer questions. The class was scrambling to finish the exam by the end and the average was a C+. But she gives you a lot of opportunities to bump your mark up through fun assignments

Pros - 4 free tutorials skips. Get a 1% boost for just emailing her explaining how you're doing in class. Interesting content. Very accommodating & kind Cons - Not enough time in exams. Half the class was still writing when time ran out, there was 3 essays, short answers & MC. Should've been enough time to review answer exams aren't remote anymore

Dr. Murdoch was one of the best professors that I've ever had at SFU. She truly cares about her students and their wellbeing, and she makes sure to check-in with her students frequently throughout the semester. Grading was clear and fair. Assignments were fun as they weren't all traditional papers. I would recommend taking Dr. Murdoch's class 100%.

Murdoch was an awesome prof! She was able to make online learning a fun experience and was also able to really build a classroom community. There was a variety of assignments to make class interesting and also a variety of different speakers, podcasts, readings, etc. Would definitely recommend a class with her.

Danielle is a great prof! The only downside is her course contains a group project worth a heavy percentage of your grade, and in my experience, group projects are not the best. So if there is a group project in the syllabus, I would avoid taking the course, as there is always the likelihood of poor peers. Other than that, great course!

Dr. Murdoch is an amazing professor and an inspirational figure. She is great at lecturing and very passionate about her work. She cares about every student in her class and goes above and beyond her duties to help students achieve a higher education. She puts a lot of work in organizing prison tours, which is a treat! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Taking this class with Danielle was incredible! No matter how dry the material is she finds a way to make it interesting. I loved every second of this class, a class I was excited to go to every week. You should definitely focus on participating in class, commenting on one or two things a week is not going to cut it. Class with Danielle is a must!

Best prof I've had at SFU so far. She is very clear and fair on guidelines - follow them and you will do well. Danielle is also very helpful and will find time to assist you in anything that you don't understand. I would highly recommend taking any class with Danielle, as she truly cares about her students!
Amazing class! very fair marker. Lectures are interesting and are based on class discussion. Would recommend this class to anyone, even if they are not interested in corrections.

Danielle is a FANTASTIC professor. She is one of the only professors that I have had that actually teaches - and is good at it. She gives you everything you need to succeed - take advantage of it. She is very clear in her expectations and when she explains course material (which she is very passionate about!) and is a very kind person. Recommend.

Great prof, loves the subject and that made it interesting for the class.  Midterm, paper and presentation.  Also, 20% participation which pretty much made attendance mandatory, but classes had great discussions which made it worthwhile.

Excellent prof. Clear expectations, is passionate about the subject, and made great and much appreciated efforts to keep her classes dynamic. Field trips, guest speakers, and lots of class participation. I learned so much in her class and truly enjoyed it, I'm sad she's moved and I won't have the opportunity to take more classes from her!

Fantastic prof! Genuine, approachable and engaged, Danielle wants all of her students to succeed and values the opinions of her students.  Her classes are interactive and engaging as she invites guest lecturers and takes the class on prison trips to really get a broad view of corrections in Canada. Super cute and will be missed.

She is an amazing prof that will go above and beyond to help you. She cares about here students and the class has a field trip to a few different prisons (your choice)! Her midterm was fairly difficult but her final was not. She has a lot of marks allocated towards participation so if you do not like to participate  then I would avoid this class.

excellent TA, would definitely recommend & take another class with her if i had the chance. she's  friendly, approachable & easy to talk to. attendance is mandatory & always participate, its a huge chunk of your grade. she marks fairly but you still need to study a decent amount of material. she'll prep you for it so there will be no surprises

Danielle is a really sweet professor! She acted great as a professor AND a TA! Very passionate and dedicated prof! She brought in excellent guest speakers and took us on great field trips! If you're looking for a fun class to take, I highly recommend this class. Probably one of the most memorable classes I've taken at SFU!

Here after round 2 of taking another class with Amy. If I may, you must be visiting this page because you are questioning whether she's worth taking a class with her or not. So take it from me who's been in her class twice, DO NOT TAKE IT. Take one less class if theres nothing better open, SHE IS NOT WORTH THE WEEKLY MIGRAINES THIS WOMAN GIVES U

Conroy is so vague about the assignments or papers you have to do. You will never see a criteria sheet in this class, nor the purpose or aim of what you are writing your paper on. No idea why she is so disorganized but this class was not worth it with her. Definitely do not recommend.

No longer teaches at SFU, but felt the need to review anyways. She was the best prof I ever had, and this class was my favourite/contributed to most of my knowledge of corrections in Canada. If you can take a class with her in Ontario (Kingston) please do, you wont regret it. Gives great feedback on papers, very approachable.
